Hey hey.. Your one and only fan .

Incredible and forever magical I was lucky to have grown up listening to the Floyd as a young kid but the 
first time I heard Shine on you crazy diamond I was blown away. This new 
album may be the last one ever but there is no denying its a masterpiece. 
It might not be the Floyd were used to hearing but we can appreciate the 
musicianship these guys have and what magic they came up with

Wow Put on some good headphones and block out an hour of uninterrupted time 
and you will not be disappointed. This is as good as anything Pink Floyd 
has ever done. And I don't care which "version" or which era you consider 
yourself to be a fan of. Every aspect of Floyd is special in its own way, 
and this album does not disappoint on any level.

An Beautiful End To An Era Pink Floyd is my favorite band. I adore all their material, from the Syd 
Barrett days, to Waters reign, to now, the Waters era being my favorite due 
to its complex construction and deeper meaning beneath the music. "The 
Endless River" is, without a doubt, a perfect goodbye. It ties together all 
aspects of the band's history. I knew I would like it, but I fell in love 
the moment I heard it.

Nothing new... ... but just what you'd expect of a Pink Floyd Album. It takes you from 
"Dark Side of the Moon" to "Wish You Were Here" through "The Wall", "The 
Division Bell" back to "Echoes". It's all in there! It is funny how you 
instantly recognize where this is coming from and who played it. The only 
thing missing is the singing... but probably because of lack of words; some 
of these songs are yelling for words and I am sure someone, one day, with a 
voice similar to that of David Gilmour will put words to it and make "The 
Endless River" a real Pink Floyd Album. I for my part just love it and if 
you have not been a Pink Floyd fan before, this will make you discover all 
the other albums. "The Endless River" is sort of the "menu de dégustation" 
of this best-ever concept album rock band. Did I forget something? YES! It 
is TIMELESS!! :-)

Good, but no Dark Side... This is essentially an album of ambient music leftovers from the Division 
Bell album sessions of 1993 or thereabouts (only one vocal track) and was 
released as a tribute to the late Rick Wright, Floyd's great keyboards man. 
If you don't buy this expecting to hear another Dark Side or Wall you will 
enjoy this fine music. If its their final release as is rumoured , not a 
bad way to end the band's stellar recording career!

More Gilmour, Less Floyd. Lovely album. Although this is, basically, a David Gilmour solo album. Not 
that that is a bad thing, but I was slightly disappointed when I first 
listened. Where is the intense Gilmour guitar that we all love, those solos 
that make you shiver? The intense drums that have your hairs stand on end? 
Well, they just don't materialise in this record. It is, however, an 
excellent album in its own right. Up there with 'The Wall' and 'Wish You 
Were Here'? Not quite.

It's a different time, so don't compare this to DSOTM, the Wall, Wish You 
Were Here, or Animals. It's not on that level but that's not a fair 
comparison. It is definitely a great listen, with plenty of familiar David 
Gilmour awesomeness and sounds (Listen to Surfacing them Poles Apart from 
Division Bell). It doesn't have that Floydian concept album feel, and at 
times feels disjointed with no central theme and all, but it makes for a 
nice listen, and makes me want more. What say you, David and Roger?

Childhood memories I was introduced to pink floyd as a child by my mother and all of her pot 
smoking friends. Absolutely fell in love with the dramatical hypnotic moods 
created by floyds music. This album takes my mind back to the days of 
relaxation and happiness as that proberbly half stoned happy child. Shame I 
had to grow up. Love love love it.

The final chapter to Pink Floyd's tremendous career! During the recording session of The Division Bell during the fall of 1993, 
Pink Floyd went back to their roots with the psychedelic/mellow sound they 
had during the late 60's & early 70's. The Endless River is superb & the 
final LP from Pink Floyd. I grew up listening to Pink Floyd back in the 
day. My first Pink Floyd LP I listen to on my Father's record player was 
The Dark Side of The Moon. (Which will have a special place in my heart) My 
first Pink Floyd concert was The Division Bell Tour in 1994.

Great album Wright's contributions on this album are among his most prolific. Gilmour 
and Mason have done an amazing job capturing the classic Floyd feel despite 
the obstacle of constructing this album in such a disjointed manner. My 
only complaint is that it is the inevitable end of The Pink Floyd.

Excellent addition and final point to Pink Floyd legacy I'm a huge Pink Floyd fan, I own every one of their albums. This one is 
not one of their best work in my taste, but it's a really good one. I'm a 
fan of musical gigs of Pink Floyd, Echoes is one of my favourite actually, 
so this album is really a nice touch to me. But yet again, this album 
wasn't advertised as a 'real' album, it's an edited set of tracks recorded 
for the double album that The Division Bell was supposed to be. I would 
place it between my fourth of fifth prefered Pink Floyd album.

Forever and ever! This is what you do with this album first night you get it: put it on your 
phone/iPod/whatever, put in your earphones, go to bed, close your eyes, 
immerse yourself in the music. I guarantee you won't know what happens next 
or how much time has passed since. But what you would get is the memory of 
the best night of your life next morning you wake up. Just do it!

Time moves on, but doesn't forget The Endless River flows between the void of Meddle and The Division Bell 
... For those of us fans who enjoy Saucer or UmmaGumma, then TER is our 
coda. Should've been simply four songs, Side 1-4 and left it at that, as 
that's how it runs. Its an album in the age of singles & digital downloads 
at that. Where it does start to languish is on the only vocal track, with 
the belabored lyrics & seeming "What God Wants" frankness that never suited 
Floyd well. If you don't own pre-1973 PF stay away.

Pink Floyd : Endless River A very serene ambient mix with that great Pink Floyd sound. The only thing 
missing is vocals by Waters. Great music to relax by or space out on when 
going to sleep.

What's old is new again? It's been 20 years since the last studio album. I've listened to it and 
I'm on the fence at this stage. I wanted to love it...I still do and maybe 
I will.

Ethereal Masterpiece This album is incredibly serene. The instrumental tracks are very calming 
and the final track, Louder Than Words is just beautiful. The album is a 
great tribute to Richard. Ultimately, this masterpiece is a great way to 
wrap up their career and is a must have for any Pink Floyd fan

Top class Been a Floyd fan for over 42yrs still play them at the ripe old age 62 
hippies never grow in the mind just lose there hair

The Endless River Pink Floyd's new album is great in my opinion even though it's a 
instrumental album apart from the last song you can tell it's Floyd and 
it's a shame it will be the last one but as I've liked Floyd all my life 
and had the pleasure of seeing them twice I class myself as lucky to of 
seen such a great band long live Pink Floyd

Another classic The album, from beginning to end, is like one big circle. It starts off 
how it ends. Very easy to listen and a hell a lot better than the vicious 
amounts of crap that is coming out from the pop music scene.

Not what you think I have to agree that this is more ambient music with one or two songs 
thrown in. Fortunately I was able to listen before buying so I'm going to 
pass on this. Not to worry, I never tire of listening to the old stuff!

Disappointed This has to be the slowest most boring album I've heard. Hit play on the 
first track and it takes about 30 seconds before anything audible comes 
through the speakers. Its music to play while your asleep. If you're 
expecting anything like their albums, Dark Side of the Moon, The Wall or 
Animals then don't bother with this.

Loved this so much Pink floyd is just amazing, and the musical harmony is so beautiful. I 
dont know how long I will just keep this on replay. It deserves its own 
playlist lol.

Absolutely Pink Floyd An utterly sweeping and at times heartbreaking farewell to one of the 
greatest rock bands of our time. It's been an honor and a privilege knowing 
and growing up with your music.

Thanks PF! Today's artists sure could learn a thing or two from you guys! Thanks for 
one more! Great stuff

Nothing compared to what they played in the past I was looking forward to this album for quite a while but I'm afraid Pink 
Floyd don't have that spark anymore. They have some quality tracks but they 
don't have that energy that they once did

days. Sounds like tracks found on wish you were here and dark side as well 
as the division bell. A good creation.

Simply suberb This album is exactly recorded like the previous pink floyd albums I.e. 
pre gilmour era. Remarkable that in this day and age you could reproduce 
all that psychedelic goodness from 1960's. Loved every second of it.

Sooo Disappointing! Just recycling old ideas, no real songs apart from track 18, just sounds 
like a Gilmour jam. It is what you would expect Floyd to sound like without 
the Waters bits (wasn't he the one that wrote the lyrics?)..

Love Pink Floyd but... Most of the songs sound like intros that lead up to... Nothing - just the 
next song.

it it lacks memorable songs in my opinion.

Brilliant individuals brilliant record I do I didn't know of the talents 
displayed I this record.. So far I only knew of their pop hits which I 
didn't rate highly.. I have only realised their individual talents now 
through the release of this lp bravo to all who got the together for this

End of an era. One of the best bands of all time releases what is essentially a jam

Magnificent I feel floating from the begin to the end... It's just amazing how Gilmour

Just bought this now, listening now, i was raised hearing pink floyd my 
whole life. I gained full interest in my teens and now have a welcome to 
the machine tattoo of the mechanical handshake. ♡ looking forward to 
getting lost in this one. I know their work will live through many decades 
more. Rip wright.

Floyd Album

Awesome Just put my Labrador down today this album has allowed me to just sit and

A bit of YEEZUS, mixed with MOTM This album was very much anticipated and the hype couldn't have been 
higher. My expectations were high given what DBR was and the litrelease 
tracks coming after. So with the track record of Travi$, I expected a great 
album, something like an extension of DBR. WRONG! The album was nothing 
like DBR. Sonically, it was a masterpiece. Less trap influence on here 
(good thing). Has it's highs and lows, but overall a well put together 
album. Proud to say that I survived the Rodeo

Great album This album has a real Yeezy feel to it. It reminds me of 808s & Heartbreak 
and My beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy with a little Yeezus mixed in. His 
flow is good and the features fit perfectly.

Trash Highly dissapointed. If you were hyped about this and expecting a good 
album, do not buy this
La Flame Don't Play No Games When this album comes out, it'll be straight fire. Rodeo Season!!

Travis Scott truly is insane hopefully you survive the rodeo
